definition: bluntly direct and outspoken but good-natured, the act of bluffing in poker, to frighten someone by pretending to be stronger than one really is
details:
adjective
- bluntly direct and outspoken but good-natured
= example: bluntly direct and outspoken but good-natured
- very steep
= synonyms: sheer
noun
- the act of bluffing in poker
= synonyms: four flush
- pretense that your position is stronger than it really is
= example: pretense that your position is stronger than it really is
- a high steep bank (usually formed by river erosion)
verb
- to frighten someone by pretending to be stronger than one really is
= example: to frighten someone by pretending to be stronger than one really is
- to deceive an opponent by a bold bet on an inferior hand with the result that the opponent withdraws a winning hand
= example: to deceive an opponent by a bold bet on an inferior hand with the result that the opponent withdraws a winning hand
= synonyms: bluff out
